messages.body: First solar world opens in France. The innovation/tech revolution we are in is amazing! http://nbcnews.to/2i7LxAs $TSLA $SCTY

links.title: Paved with sunshine: World's first solar panel road opens in Normandy, France
links.description: France has just opened what it claims is the first public solar panel road in the world, officials said on Thursday. The French Ministry of the Environment announced the inauguration of the "unprecedented" new road on Thursday, which is covered by solar panels and stretches for more than half mile in the town of Tourouvre-au-Perche in Normandy, France.

links.title: Loving What Others Hate
links.description: ( Photo credit) Investing is a tricky business. When you invest in a stock you truly don't know where the stock price might end up. It's quite unsettling. One day the stock price goes up. The next day the price goes down.

links.title: Tesla's 1.3 Billion Mile Advantage Over Its Competitors
links.description: There was, in hindsight, a clear element of risk to Tesla Motors Inc.'s decision to install Autopilot hardware in every car coming off the production line since October 2014. It paid a price, with federal regulators probing the deadly crash of a Model S while in driver-assist mode and critics slamming Tesla for rolling the technology out too soon.

links.title: Back-of-the-Napkin Analysis: Chipotle Mexican Grill, Inc.'s Rebound -- The Motley Fool
links.description: The news that ( Chipotle Mexican Grill NYSE:CMG) co-CEO Monty Moran was stepping down, after running the company alongside founder Steve Ells since January 2009, caused shares to slide by around 6%. To make matters worse, Ells, now the sole CEO, admitted during an investor conference that he was nervous about hitting fiscal 2017 guidance.

links.title: Hold Your Applause for Tesla's Solar Panel Deal
links.description: Tesla Motors announced on Tuesday that it had finalized a deal with Panasonic to make solar panels at a factory in Buffalo. Wall Street cheered the news, with shares rising 2.7% in afternoon trading, to $219.
